case_title: Ch. NASEER-UD-DIN vs GOVERNMENT OF WEST PAKISTAN THROUGH CHIEF SECRETARY, CIVIL SECRETARIAT, LAHORE AND 2 OTHERS
respondant: Government of West Pakistan through Chief Secretary, Civil Secretariat, Lahore
complaint_summary: Petitioner challenged disciplinary action reducing him from Tehsildar to Naib-Tehsildar for two years due to inefficiency proven in inquiry.
investigation_summary: Inquiry conducted by Special Judge (Anti-Corruption)-cum-Enquiry Officer found inefficiency in mutation corrections and rent suit disposal but exonerated petitioner of corruption charges.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the petition, holding that the amendment exempting consultation with the Public Service Commission was valid and inefficiency charges were substantiated by evidence.
punishment: Demotion from Tehsildar to Naib-Tehsildar for two years.
legal_arguments: Consultation with Public Service Commission was obligatory under Article 186 of the 1962 Constitution.
Amendment exempting consultation was ultra vires.
Inefficiency finding was unwarranted based on evidence.
key_issues: Validity of amendment exempting consultation with Public Service Commission
Protection of pre-Constitution service rights under Article 234

legal_terms.Mutation: A change or correction in land revenue records.
legal_terms.Tehsildar: Revenue officer in charge of a tehsil.

words_and_phrases.Inefficiency: Failure to perform duties as per prescribed standards.

summary_vector_notes: Petitioner challenged disciplinary action reducing him in rank due to inefficiency proven in inquiry. Court upheld amendment exempting consultation with Public Service Commission and found charges substantiated.
